Class UserHomeController

java.lang.Object
view.UserHomeController
public class UserHomeController extends Object
Controller for the User Home view. This class handles the logic for managing user albums, including creating, renaming, deleting, and opening albums. It also provides functionality for logging out, searching photos, and viewing tag types. The controller interacts with the Photos application and the User model.

Features include:

  • Displaying a list of albums
  • Managing albums (create, delete, rename)
  • Opening an album view
  • Logging out and switching views

Author:
Reuben Thomas, Ryan Zaken

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init(Photos app, User user)
      Initializes the controller with the application and user data.
      Parameters:
      app - The main Photos application instance.
      user - The currently logged-in User.

    • getUser

      public User getUser()
      Gets the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The User object representing the logged-in user.

    • populateAlbums

      public void populateAlbums()
      Populates the ListView with the user's albums. Sets up a custom cell factory to display album names.

    • setStatusMessage

      public void setStatusMessage(String message)
      Sets a status message to be displayed in the status label.
      Parameters:
      message - The status message to display.

    • showError

      public void showError(String message)
      Displays an error message in an alert dialog.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to display.

    • showWarning

      public void showWarning(String message)
      Displays a warning message in an alert dialog.
      Parameters:
      message - The warning message to display.

    • showConfirmation

      public Optional<javafx.scene.control.ButtonType> showConfirmation(String message)
      Displays a confirmation dialog with the given message.
      Parameters:
      message - The confirmation message to display.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the user's response.

    • handleLogout

      public void handleLogout()
      Handles the logout action by switching to the login view.

    • handleViewTagTypes

      public void handleViewTagTypes()
      Handles the action to view the user's tag types. Loads and displays the tag types dialog.

    • handleSearchPhotos

      public void handleSearchPhotos()
      Handles the action to search photos. Loads and displays the search photos view.

    • handleCreateAlbum

      public void handleCreateAlbum()
      Handles the action to create a new Album. Prompts the user for an album name and adds it to the user's albums.

    • handleDeleteAlbum

      public void handleDeleteAlbum()
      Handles the action to delete the selected Album. Prompts the user for confirmation before deleting.

    • handleRenameAlbum

      public void handleRenameAlbum()
      Handles the action to rename the selected Album. Prompts the user for a new album name and updates the album.

    • handleOpenAlbum

      public void handleOpenAlbum()
      Handles the action to open the selected Album. Loads and displays the album view.
